=== MOTU Meetings ===

''''''

We've been quite good at keeping up a rhythm of running MOTU meetings every two weeks. 

At <nowiki>[[MOTU-Meetings]]</nowiki> you'll find:
* the agenda of the next meeting,
* meeting logs
Find Meeting Logs, the agenda

=== Universe HUG Day ===

Every now and then we'll have a Universe HUG Day. 

==== What will we do there? ====

0. First of all we'll take care of <nowiki>[[MOTU-TODO-Bugs|bugs]]</nowiki>. We'll triage them, fix them and do whatever we can to clean up Ubuntu's Universe's bugs.
** <nowiki>[[HelpingWithBugs]]</nowiki> has more information about that.
0. We mark bugs as `bitesize` and offer Mentoring for bugs where we think they are suited for mentoring.

==== Who can help out? ====

Everybody. If you always wanted to help MOTUs and become one yourself one day, just join <nowiki>[[irc:--irc.freenode.net-ubuntu-motu|#ubuntu-motu]]</nowiki> to get started.

=== MOTU Q&A sessions ===

''''''

In MOTU Q&A sessions, we:
* try to answer all questions that new contributors have
** concerning MOTU processes, how to get involved, how to get Ubuntu Development done
** concerning packaging

Don't hesitate to share your problems and experiences there.

We meet in <nowiki>[[http://webchat.freenode.net/?channels=ubuntu-classroom|#ubuntu-classroom]]</nowiki> on irc.freenode.net. Usually every friday.

=== Packaging Training sessions ===

''''''

In <nowiki>[[Packaging-Training]]</nowiki> sessions, we:
* demonstrate packaging techniques, 
* showcase packaging tools
* answer questions 

Come in masses, ask questions, get involved!

We meet in <nowiki>[[http://webchat.freenode.net/?channels=ubuntu-classroom|#ubuntu-classroom]]</nowiki> on irc.freenode.net.

=== Packaging Jams ===

An Ubuntu Packaging Jam is an event in which packaging skills are taught to a group of people. Jams are typically delivered by Ubuntu LoCo teams, and they are an excellent means of not only providing events for a LoCo team but also a great way to get more people involved in Ubuntu development.

'''To see how to run a Packaging Jam <nowiki>[[MOTU-RunningPackagingJam|click here]]</nowiki>!'''
